Posts.Content: mtgirl wrote: I try not to buy trouble but this getting overwhelming. I was notified after my mammogram that they found a "dense area" in my breast and set me up for an ultrasound. Scary, but the odds are in my favor, right? The next day my doctor's office called and he is referring me to a surgeon to review the results after my ultrasound. This has me completely freaked out. Being a logical individual, I want someone to tell me the percentages.   I just lost my job in a corporate layoff, my husband is disabled, and in a couple of months my insurance will run out. I have some good prospects on a new job, but what would I do if I have to tell them I need surgery/treatment? I have a friend in the final stages of breast cancer, and it has invaded my life far too many times. I feel as though, for the first time in my life, this is just more than I can handle. Please tell me I'm overreacting and that this is all normal procedure in a case like this? Log in to post a reply
